name: A
label: Routine A
description: Technical facility, vocabulary building & application over backing tracks

exercises.name: Legato Warmup
exercises.description: 3 note per string sequences, slow pace, focus on clarity
exercises.instructions: Play legato patterns across all 6 strings. Hammer-ons and pull-offs should be clean and even in volume.

exercises.name: String-skipping Pentatonic Patterns
exercises.description: Practice pentatonic scale patterns with string skipping
exercises.instructions: Skip strings while navigating pentatonic shapes. Focus on accuracy over speed.

exercises.name: Bend Accuracy
exercises.description: Play destination note, then bend up to it. Try to add vibrato on top.
exercises.instructions: First play the target note clean, then bend to match it from below. Add vibrato once you nail the pitch.

exercises.name: Double-Stops
exercises.instructions: Work on 2-3 double-stop licks. Focus on timing, intonation and dynamics.

exercises.name: Box Connection Licks
exercises.description: Licks that connect pentatonic box positions
exercises.instructions: Practice licks that smoothly move between adjacent pentatonic boxes.

exercises.name: ii-V-I Turnarounds
exercises.description: Practice ii-V-I chord progression turnaround licks
exercises.instructions: Work on turnaround phrases. Focus on voice leading and smooth resolution.

exercises.name: Sliding 6ths
exercises.instructions: Play 6th intervals on adjacent string pairs, sliding up and down the neck.

exercises.name: Blue Note Insertion
exercises.description: Practice inserting blue notes (b5) into pentatonic phrases
exercises.instructions: Add the flat-5 chromatic passing tone into your pentatonic licks for that blues flavour.

exercises.name: Solo: Bends + Vibrato Only
exercises.description: Solo over a backing track using only bends and vibrato
exercises.instructions: Limit yourself to bends and vibrato as your primary expression tools.

exercises.name: Solo: Sliding + Double Stops Only
exercises.description: Solo over a backing track using only slides and double stops

exercises.name: Solo: Single String Only
exercises.description: Solo using only one string at a time. Switch strings every ~2 minutes.
exercises.instructions: Force yourself to explore the entire range of a single string before switching.

exercises.name: Lyrical Phrasing
exercises.description: Solo with a focus on making it 'lyrical'. Think singer or saxophonist.
exercises.instructions: Be deliberate about melodic range, spacing, and note length. Rests are golden. Be mindful of syncopation. Place notes purposefully.
